body_html:
Actually after fixing this bazel LICENSE url the bazel build runs but it issues following error:

Step 17/21 : RUN ./configure &&     bazel build -c opt tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package &&     bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip &&     pip install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow-*.whl
 ---> Running in aee485194515
No Google Cloud Platform support will be enabled for TensorFlow
No GPU support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Configuration finished
INFO: Reading 'startup' options from /root/.bazelrc: --batch
Extracting Bazel installation...
WARNING: Sandboxed execution is not supported on your system and thus hermeticity of actions cannot be guaranteed. See http://bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#sandboxing for more information. You can turn off this warning via --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing.
____Loading package: tensorflow/tools/pip_package
____Loading...
____Loading package: tensorflow/tensorboard
____Loading package: tensorflow
____Loading package: tensorflow/core
____Loading package: tensorflow/models/embedding
____Loading package: tensorflow/models/image/mnist
____Loading package: tensorflow/python
____Loading package: @bazel_tools//tools/cpp
____Loading package: tensorflow/models/rnn/ptb
____Loading package: tools/defaults
____Loading package: @local_jdk//
____Loading package: tensorflow/tensorboard/backend
____Loading package: tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/python
ERROR: /tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorboard/bower/BUILD:5:1: no such package '@iron_icons//': Error cloning repository: https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack caused by https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack caused by https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack caused by https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack caused by https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack and referenced by '//tensorflow/tensorboard/bower:bower'.
ERROR: Loading failed; build aborted.
____Elapsed time: 3.482s
The command '/bin/sh -c ./configure &&     bazel build -c opt tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package &&     bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip &&     pip install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow-*.whl' returned a non-zero code: 1
FAIL: docker build of sebastien/tensorflow:0.9-devel with Dockerfile /tmp/tmp.aR8ZXgxsaB/Dockerfile failed

Considering the Dockerfile.devel of the master branch the Bazel version may have to be upgraded from 0.2.1 to 0.5.0
And may be also the --recursive option should be removed from the RUN git clone --recursive https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git && \

body:
Actually after fixing this bazel LICENSE url the bazel build runs but it issues following error:
```
Step 17/21 : RUN ./configure &&     bazel build -c opt tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package &&     bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip &&     pip install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow-*.whl
 ---> Running in aee485194515
No Google Cloud Platform support will be enabled for TensorFlow
No GPU support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Configuration finished
INFO: Reading 'startup' options from /root/.bazelrc: --batch
Extracting Bazel installation...
WARNING: Sandboxed execution is not supported on your system and thus hermeticity of actions cannot be guaranteed. See http://bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#sandboxing for more information. You can turn off this warning via --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing.
____Loading package: tensorflow/tools/pip_package
____Loading...
____Loading package: tensorflow/tensorboard
____Loading package: tensorflow
____Loading package: tensorflow/core
____Loading package: tensorflow/models/embedding
____Loading package: tensorflow/models/image/mnist
____Loading package: tensorflow/python
____Loading package: @bazel_tools//tools/cpp
____Loading package: tensorflow/models/rnn/ptb
____Loading package: tools/defaults
____Loading package: @local_jdk//
____Loading package: tensorflow/tensorboard/backend
____Loading package: tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/python
ERROR: /tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorboard/bower/BUILD:5:1: no such package '@iron_icons//': Error cloning repository: https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack caused by https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack caused by https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack caused by https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack caused by https://github.com/polymerelements/iron-icons.git: cannot open git-upload-pack and referenced by '//tensorflow/tensorboard/bower:bower'.
ERROR: Loading failed; build aborted.
____Elapsed time: 3.482s
The command '/bin/sh -c ./configure &&     bazel build -c opt tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package &&     bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/pip &&     pip install --upgrade /tmp/pip/tensorflow-*.whl' returned a non-zero code: 1
FAIL: docker build of sebastien/tensorflow:0.9-devel with Dockerfile /tmp/tmp.aR8ZXgxsaB/Dockerfile failed
```
Considering the Dockerfile.devel of the master branch the Bazel version may have to be upgraded from 0.2.1 to 0.5.0
And may be also the `--recursive` option should be removed from the `RUN git clone --recursive https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git && \`
